def_en: If you clean up a mess or clean up a place where there is a mess, you make things tidy and free of dirt again.
To clean up something such as the environment or an industrial process means to make it free from substances or processes that cause pollution.

def_cn: (警方或当局)肃清，整肃(犯罪、腐败等)
def_en: If the police or authorities clean up a place or area of activity, they make it free from crime, corruption, and other unacceptable forms of behaviour.

def_cn: （尤指在干脏活后）收拾干净，弄整洁
def_en: If you go and clean up, you make yourself clean and tidy, especially after doing something that has made you dirty.
If someone cleans up, they make a large profit or get a lot of money.
